org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel

Interface Configurable<ConfigurationType>

  • Type Parameters:
    ConfigurationType - the ConfigurationType associated with the workflow item. This is an arbitrary java class that provides details on how the item is configured. To allow successful serialisation it's recommended to keep this configuration as a simple Java bean.
    All Superinterfaces:
    WorkflowItem
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Activity<ConfigurationType>, AsynchronousActivity<ConfigurationType>, DispatchLayer<ConfigurationType>, MonitorableAsynchronousActivity<ConfigType>, PropertyContributingDispatchLayer<ConfigType>, SupersededActivity<ConfigurationType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractActivity, AbstractAsynchronousActivity, AbstractDispatchLayer, AbstractErrorHandlerLayer, DataflowActivity, DisabledActivity, DispatchStackImpl.TopLayer, ErrorBounce, Failover, IntermediateProvenance, Invoke, Loop, NonExecutableActivity, Parallelize, Retry, Stop, StringConstantActivity, UnrecognizedActivity

    public interface Configurable<ConfigurationType>
extends WorkflowItem
    Interface for workflow items that can be configured from a bean.
    Author:
    Tom Oinn, Stian Soiland-Reyes
    See Also:
    ActivityConfigurationException

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void configure(ConfigurationType conf)
      When the item is built from the workflow definition XML the object is first constructed with a default constructor then this method is called, passing in the configuration bean returned by getConfiguration().
      ConfigurationType getConfiguration()
      Each item stores configuration within a bean of type ConfigurationType, this method returns the configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfiguration

        ConfigurationType getConfiguration()
        Each item stores configuration within a bean of type ConfigurationType, this method returns the configuration. This is used by the automatic serialisation framework to store the item definition in the workflow XML.

      • configure

        void configure(ConfigurationType conf)
        throws ConfigurationException
        When the item is built from the workflow definition XML the object is first constructed with a default constructor then this method is called, passing in the configuration bean returned by getConfiguration().
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if a problem occurs when configuring the item
